meanings.def: to become smaller, especially when washed in water that is too hot; to make clothes, cloth, etc. smaller in this way
examples: My sweater shrank in the wash.

meanings.def: to become or to make something smaller in size or amount
examples: The tumour had shrunk to the size of a pea.
The market for their products is shrinking.
shrink something The internet in a sense has shrunk the world.
Households have been shrinking in size but increasing in number.
Their profits shrank by 4% last year.
Their share of the market has shrunk from 14% to 5%.

meanings.def: to move back or away from something because you are frightened or shocked
examples: He shrank back against the wall as he heard them approaching.
I shrank back into the shadows.
She sees her shrink once a week.
